input_text:
Job Title: Entry Level Traffic EIT

Location: Tempe, AZ

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Marketing, Public Relations, Writing/Editing

Description:
Entry Level Traffic EIT - (WES0004O1) Your Impact

Do you strive to create more connected, sustainable communities with impactful traffic solutions? So do we!

By joining our Arizona - Tempe team of highway/traffic design professionals, we’ll expand on your engineering analysis and design expertise so we can create sustainable impacts through corridor studies, traffic simulation, traffic signal design, ITS design, Maintenance of Traffic (MOT), transportation impact analysis, pedestrian and transit studies. This traffic work associated with roadway and bridge projects will shape lasting solutions which will ease future commutes.

You’ll be able to showcase your writing skills with report ****** on projects with multiple clients; Municipalities and Department of Transportations (DOTs) throughout Arizona and the West.

You’ll receive guidance from the best Engineers and Project Man******rs in the business. We want you to be empowered to deliver the boldest solutions for everyday living.

We want you to empower you to think beyond and innovate!

Here's What You'll Need

BS in Civil Engineering with a focus in Transportation/Traffic engineering discipline is requiredEIT certification is a plus.Strong analytical, conceptual, communication and organizational skills. Experience with Traffic analysis software (Synchro/SimTraffic, DynusT, VISSIM, CORSIM, HCS) is required. Ability to enhance current software skills is required.Experience with design software (i.e., AutoCAD, MicroStation, InRoads etc.) and its application in roadway, highway, intersection and interchange design is required.Preparation of technical reports is required eg: traffic impact studies, safety studies, corridor plans, operations analysis, multi-modal studies etc.Knowledge with preparation of plans, specification and estimates to state and local standards is required.Previous work experience with DOT and municipalities is requiredExperience in conducting traffic engineering projects such as signal timing, signing, striping, and signal design, construction traffic control, is a plus

You Will Use Your Technical Knowledge And Experience To

Perform traffic analysis tasks from data collection, reporting analysis results and writing technical reports.Perform traffic engineering design, calculations, sketches, drawings, technical comparisons and similar technical work as required by assignments.Develop design plans, specifications, and estimates for transportation projectsFunction as a technical specialist formulating and developing advanced engineering concepts and techniques Maintain effective communication with project team members and with clients Research transit, traffic analysis, traffic operations, ITS and safety issues and work with City, State, and County officials.Demonstrate proficiency in using computer-assisted engineering and design software and equipment, Traffic analysis and simulation software, and other office production software to perform engineering tasks

Jacobs is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to ******, ******, creed, ******, ****** ******, ancestry, ****** (including ******, childbirth, breast******ding, or medical conditions related to ******, childbirth, or breast******ding), ******, medical condition, marital or domestic partner status, ******ual ******, ******, ****** ******, ****** expression and trans****** status, mental ****** or physical ******, genetic information, military or veteran status, ******ship, low-income status or any other status or characteristic protected by applicable law. Learn more about your rights under Federal EEO laws and supplemental langu******. Fountainhead Pkwy Suite 401 Tempe 85282Capabilities: Cities and Places

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
